util

Class CommandLineParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.CommandLineParser

  • public class CommandLineParser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles entering command line parameters. Classes that require a large or an arbitrary number of parameters (or parameters where the order is a bit unclear and arbitrary) should use this class for fetching parameters from the command line. The input for a single parameter is assumed to be like this: -param_name::param_val_1,param_val_2,...,param_val_n Different parameter input items are separated by empty spaces. If the class is to be used to also output info() help before main method call, it needs to be given prior information. If not, it can be used to just fetch data easily in arbitrary ordering. If a parameter is encountered twice and multivalued, all encountered values will be used.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandLineParser

        public CommandLineParser(boolean priorInfo)
        Parameters:
        priorInfo - Boolean indicating whether to use prior information for notifying the user of parameter info and for parsing the parameters. If not, the parameters will be fetched automatically, without structure.

    • Method Detail

      • hasParamDefinition

        public boolean hasParamDefinition(java.lang.String paramName)
        Checks if the specified parameter is already defined in the hash.
        Parameters:
        paramName - String that is the parameter name.
        Returns:
        True if already defined, false otherwise.

        public boolean hasParamValue(java.lang.String paramName)

        Returns:
        True if a value already exists, false otherwise.

      • setIgnoreExtraParams

        public void setIgnoreExtraParams(boolean ignoreExtraParams)
        Parameters:
        ignoreExtraParams - Boolean flag indicating whether to ignore when unknown parameters are encountered in the prior info mode or to throw an exception.

      • addParam

        public void addParam(java.lang.String paramName,
            java.lang.String paramDesc,
            int paramType,
            boolean obligatory,
            boolean multipleValues)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Add a new parameter specification to the expected structure.
        Parameters:
        paramName - String that is the parameter name.
        paramDesc - String that is the parameter description, for informing the user.
        paramType - Integer that is the parameter type.
        obligatory - Boolean, indicating whether the parameter is mandatory.
        multipleValues - Boolean, indicating whether the parameter takes multiple values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
